thread.title: Algeria: Algeria, Spain Positioned As 'Important' Economic Partners - Sellal

title: Algeria: Algeria, Spain Positioned As 'Important' Economic Partners - Sellal
text:
Algeria, Spain Positioned As 'Important' Economic Partners - Sellal Tagged: Sudan: Unamid Celebrates Nelson Mandela Day 
Madrid — Algeria and Spain are positioned as "important" economic partners, said Tuesday in Madrid, Prime Minister Abdelmalek Sellal, noting the existence between the two countries of a "major potentialities to be commonly exploited." 
"Thanks to a trade volume valued at USD 15 billion in the two recent years, Algeria and Spain represent important economic partners as major potentialities can be exploited in common , apart from hydrocarbons, in other key sectors that have made progress and need to be developed, like housing and construction, basic infrastructure, SME, agro-industry and tourism," said Sellal at the opening of the 6th meeting of the High Level meeting between Algeria and Spain. Related Topics Sudan: Unamid Celebrates Nelson Mandela Day 
The Prime Minister said he is "satisfied" with cooperation that "has strengthened appreciably" through "increased" presence of Spanish companies in various sectors, such as public works and infrastructure, transport, Water Resources and SMEs/SMIs. 
"We welcome the development of a multifaceted and dynamic partnership. This trend should be promoted and encouraged by the intensification of exchanges and meetings between our traders," he pleaded. 
Sellal argued that the diversification of relations between Algeria and Spain noticed a "steadily improving" progress, including the field of human relations and the movement of people, as well as the cultural and scientific fields. 
"I hope both countries are resolutely involved in the establishment of a more open cooperation," he said. Algeria
